page.title: 15Hilliers At Newmarket.
page.content: Hilliers has been in existence since 1819.In the olden days pigs were brought from Ireland and Wales to England, where they were driven along the A4 from Bristol to London. Often, pigs would be sold to people on the way. These people would send them to Hilliers where they were killed, boned, salted, cured, dried, smoked and made into bacon.Until recently pigs were reared in this vallley.In 1980 they stopped killing pigs at this factory. Hilliers was amalgamated with another factory called Sovereign Foods in the West Midlands.There are 3 factories, one for pies and pasties, one for sausages and one for meats. The first two factories are in Newmarket and the other one is in the West Midlands.
